scenes.background: The team has successfully completed an important project, and everyone is excited to organize a celebration. However, there are differing opinions on how to celebrate. Colleague Sam suggests going to a bar for a lively party, Emma prefers a formal dinner, and Ryan proposes an outdoor team-building activity. You propose to vote on each option and go with the majority's choice to ensure everyone feels included. The team agrees, and a vote is conducted. The result is a tie between the formal dinner and the outdoor team-building activity. Monica says, 'I think the formal dinner would be more appropriate given the hard work we've put in.' Bob counters, 'But we deserve to have some fun and relax, an outdoor activity sounds perfect.' You decide that a formal dinner would be a great way to celebrate. Monica looks pleased, but Bob seems disappointed and crosses his arms. Bob sighs and says, 'Well, if we're doing a formal dinner, I guess we should at least make it interesting. Any ideas?' Monica nods eagerly and adds, 'Yes, let's make it special.' You suggest keeping it simple and elegant. Bob reluctantly nods, but his enthusiasm seems to wane. Monica smiles and says, 'That sounds perfect.' Bob mutters under his breath, 'Sure, if you like boring.' You propose a short team-building game before dinner to keep it interesting. Bob's mood lifts slightly but he still looks unconvinced. Monica claps her hands and says, 'That's a great idea!'
scenes.description: Bob smirks and says, 'Alright, but it better be a fun game. Any suggestions?' Monica looks at you expectantly.

options.text: How about a quick trivia game related to our project?
options.analysis: This option shows a high level of emotional detection and empathy by suggesting an engaging activity related to the team's accomplishments. It demonstrates good social skills and motivation.

options.text: Let's just have a simple icebreaker game to start the dinner.
options.analysis: This choice shows good self-regulation and social skills but slightly lower empathy as it opts for a straightforward approach.

options.text: Why not skip the game and go straight to dinner? We're all tired.
options.analysis: This option reflects a lack of motivation and lower social skills by dismissing the idea of adding anything extra to the dinner.
